questions.question: Access and use of the internet

content.description: Include information on percentage of people in the business who use computers with internet access, type of connection and download speed, use of portable devices, website, and social media.
Include information on percentage of turnover that comes from online orders and where these orders originate from.
Include information on paper and electronic invoices issued by your business.
Include information on cloud computing services used by your business to access software, computing power, storage capacity etc.
Include information on the analysis, sale and purchase of big data.
Include information on employment and training of ICT specialists
Include information on your business use of 3D printers and 3D printing activities.
Include information on the use of industrial and service robots.

blocks.title: E-Commerce
blocks.description:
Include information on percentage of turnover that comes from online orders and where these orders originate from.

E-Commerce is the sale or purchase of goods or services conducted over computer networks by methods specifically designed for the purpose of receiving or placing of orders. The payment and the delivery of the goods or services do not have to be conducted online.

questions.title: During {{ metadata['period_str'] }}, did {{ metadata['trad_as_or_runame'] }} receive any orders from customers for goods or services via a website or 'app'?

content.description: Include:

list: orders received for utilities, goods, materials or services via an online store, web forms on a website or extranet or 'app'
reservations made online that resulted in receiving an order

content.description: Exclude:

list: orders made by manually typed email, EDI, fax, automated telephone entry, phone (person to person)
enquiries or reservations that did not result in receiving an order

definitions.title: What are Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) type messages?

content.description: EDI messages allow the exchange of business documents between trading partners in a standard or structured machine readable form. EDI is used to electronically transfer documents such as purchase orders, invoice or shipping bills. Businesses should  be able to process this data without having to manually record it (i.e. processing should be automated).

options.label: Yes, we received orders via EDI-type messages

blocks.title: Big Data Analysis
blocks.description: Include information on the analysis, sale and purchase of big data by your business.

questions.title: During {{ metadata['period_str'] }}, from which of the following sources did {{ metadata['trad_as_or_runame'] }} analyse big data?
questions.description: If your business did not analyse big data from any of the following sources, please leave this page blank and click 'save and continue'.

content.description: Big Data is the study of data sets that are generated from electronic activities and from machine-to-machine communications, for example, from social media or production processes. Big Data analysis refers to the use of techniques, technologies and software tools for analysing big data from your own business or other data sources.

options.label: The business' own data from smart devices or sensors
options.value: The business' own data from smart devices or sensors
options.description: For example, machine to machine communications, digital sensors, RFID tags

options.label: Geolocation data from the use of portable devices
options.value: Geolocation data from the use of portable devices
options.description: For example, portable devices using mobile telephone networks, wireless connections or GPS

options.label: Data generated from social media
options.value: Data generated from social media
options.description: For example, social networks, blogs, multimedia content sharing website

options.label: Other big data sources not specified above
options.value: Other big data sources not specified above

list: vast amounts of data generated over time.
variety in terms of different formats of complex data, either structured or unstructured (for example text, video, images, voice, docs, sensor data, activity logs, click streams, coordinates).
velocity in terms of the high speed at which data are generated, become available and change over time.

values: The business' own data from smart devices or sensors
Geolocation data from the use of portable devices
Other big data sources not specified above

blocks.title: Use of Robotics
blocks.description: Include information on the use of industrial and service robots.

questions.title: Does {{ metadata['trad_as_or_runame'] }} use industrial robots?

content.description: Exclude service robots (robots with a degree of autonomy)

An industrial robot is an automatically controlled, reprogrammable, multipurpose manipulator programmable in three or more axes, which may be either fixed in place or mobile for use. Most existing industrial robots are based on the robot arm with a solid base and a series of links and joints with an end effector that carries out the task.

options.label: Yes, we use industrial robots
options.value: Yes, we use industrial robots

options.label: No, we do not use industrial robots
options.value: No, we do not use industrial robots

content.description: Robotic welding, robotic laser cutting or robotic spray painting

questions.title: Does {{ metadata['trad_as_or_runame'] }} use service robots?

content.description: Exclude industrial robots

A service robot is a machine that has a degree of autonomy that enables it to operate in complex and dynamic environments, and may require interaction with persons, objects or other devices. They are designed to fit their tasks, working in the air (e.g. as a drone), under water, or on land, using wheels or legs to achieve mobility with arms and end effectors to physically interact and are often used in inspection and maintenance tasks.

options.label: Yes, we use service robots
options.value: Yes, we use service robots

options.label: No, we do not use service robots
options.value: No, we do not use service robots

content.description: Robots for surveillance, robots for cleaning or robots for transportation

content.description: Exclude industrial robots

A service robot is a machine that has a degree of autonomy that enables it to operate in complex and dynamic environments, and may require interaction with persons, objects or other devices. They are designed to fit their tasks, working in the air (e.g. as a drone), under water, or on land, using wheels or legs to achieve mobility with arms and end effectors to physically interact and are often used in inspection and maintenance tasks.
